turns.transcript: Not to mention Malibu Koothrappali and his totally bitchin’ dream house.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: We don’t need Malibu Koothrappali’s dream house.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Really, smart guy? Where’s he supposed to park his sweet little Corvette?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, is everyone clear on the plan?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yes. Koothrappali’s going to wet himself, I’m gonna throw up, Sheldon’s gonna run away, and you’re going to die. Shall we synchronize our watches?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Guys, there are four of us and one of him.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Which means his triumph will be even larger. Minstrels will write songs about him.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, how about this? I’ll do the talking, you just stand behind me and try to look formidable.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I should’ve peed before we left.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: Yeah?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hi, Kurt.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: Lenny, right?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t really go by Lenny, but that’s okay. Um, you remember Sheldon, Howard and Raj.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: No. What do you want?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You don’t remember me? How could he not remember me?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, not now.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I remember him.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, here it is. Penny’s in kind of a financial jam, and the money that you owe her would go a long way to solving her problems.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: And she sent you to get it from me?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, no, she’s too proud to ask for the money. I, on the other hand, feel you should honour your debt.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: You do?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Feel is a kind of a… it’s a strong word. Um, I just think it would be a nice gesture on your part.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: She’ll get it when she gets it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, there you go. Problem solved.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: A successful quest. Now let’s go find a gas station with a clean bathroom.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, the problem isn’t solved. He just blew us off.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’ve got it. He didn’t remember me because the last time we met I was in a Halloween costume.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Come on, Leonard, let’s go

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No. You can leave if you want to. I’m gonna see this through.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay. (They leave)

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I guess, technically, that was my fault. (Knocks) I’m not leaving here without Penny’s money.

turns.speaker: Kurt
turns.transcript: What happened to your backup?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t need backup. I have right on my side. And I’m wearing cargo shorts under my pants.

turns.speaker: Jesse
turns.transcript: You’re back.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yes, I am, there’s a few more things I want to say to you. Stuart’s store is just fine, and he’s a much nicer person than you are, and if you still have that comic, I’d like to buy it right now.

turns.speaker: Jesse
turns.transcript: No problem. Oh, you want a latte while you wait?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: No, I don’t want a latte. I want a cappuccino and a blueberry scone.

turns.speaker: Jesse
turns.transcript: I only have chocolate chip.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, that sounds even better.

scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Under normal circumstances I’d say, I told you so. But as I have told you so with such vehemence and frequency already, the phrase has lost all meaning. Therefore, I will be replacing it with the phrase I informed you thusly.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ooh. Can’t wait for that to start.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I informed you thusly.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Eight for 28.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: This is where we could have been if we hadn’t stopped for dinner. This is where we could have been if Koothrappali hadn’t ordered dessert.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well I earned it, dude, I ate all my broccoli.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And here’s where we are. The runts in a large litter, unlikely to ever reach the nourishing teats of Indiana Jones.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So I guess it’s a good thing we stopped for dinner.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You know, guys, when facing disappointment, Eat, Pray, Love teaches us–

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, shut up.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So, where were we?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I believe we were kissing like randy teenagers, and your nose was whistling ever so slightly.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I’m sorry.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, don’t be. You were like a foxy tea kettle.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, shall we start over?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Very well.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What’s wrong?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m not sure. Earlier tonight, things began organically, and now it’s feeling forced, like all the Pirates of the Caribbean sequels.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay, that makes sense. I mean, the mood’s a little different now. We, we don’t have to rush.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I know, but just, Leonard and Penny think we’re doing it, and I don’t want to disappoint them.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: And the mood continues to change.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, and also, I don’t want to disappoint you. I, you know, come on, it’s your birthday. I can soldier through this.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hold on. I think I might have a little surprise that might help get things back on track.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Intriguing. Is back on track a hint that it has something to do with trains?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because if it did have to do with trains, and you were gonna give…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: It’s not about trains.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not even a cozy sleeper car on the Orient Express?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Stop talking about trains.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Who’s killing the mood now?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: How about those guys on that bench over there? They look pathetic. I bet we could talk to them.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: That’s a mirror.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: Guard
turns.transcript: Hey, fellas, mall’s closing.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Sorry.

turns.speaker: Guard
turns.transcript: Yeah. Good night.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Uh, excuse me.

turns.speaker: Guard
turns.transcript: Yeah?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Uh, do, do you like being a mall security guard?

turns.speaker: Guard
turns.transcript: It’s all right.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Okay, nice talking to you.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Smooth.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Ugh. What is that? (Entering) Why did you switch sides?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Be grateful I’m still in the room.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Comfy?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I’m just happy I don’t know what this memory foam remembers.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon? I know we took coitus off the table, but I was wondering how you feel about other forms of intimacy, such as snuggling.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, it’s funny you should ask, because I was wondering how you’d feel about separating the two of us with a pillow wall.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon, I’ve made more than enough accommodations for you. We’re both grown adults, we’ve been far more intimate than this. If you don’t want to snuggle, fine, but we’re not building a pillow wall.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, well, I am sorry. I’m just worried that my sensitivity to temperature could make this a rough night. And no offence, but your bottom radiates enough heat, I’m surprised there aren’t iguanas lying on it.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Here you go.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Shall we toast?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: To Howard and Bernadette, and the house key they never asked me to return.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You said you got it back.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, clearly, I lied.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: So how’s your apartment?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Not great. The electricity’s out.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: So why don’t you get it fixed?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I called, and they’re like, pay your bill.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: If you ever need somewhere to crash, there’s always my place.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, no. I don’t want to be an inconvenience. You’ve got all your lady friends, and…

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Actually, I’m single now.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: What? When did that happen?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: It’s okay. It’s by choice. Well, their choice, and it’s not okay.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh. Sorry. I didn’t know.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Nobody does. I was embarrassed so I didn’t say anything.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Why wouldn’t he tell us? Are we bad friends?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: He’s in our hot tub drinking our wine.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah, he deserves to be alone.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: So you’re back out on the dating scene now?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yeah, yeah, a little.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, that must be fun. How’s that going?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I’m in a hot tub with you, so pretty bad.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Do you really need me to transcribe this?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re not doing it for me. You’re doing it for future generations who will benefit from my struggle. (Voice on recorder) Sheldon’s Mine Simulation Log, entry four. My Kit Kat has melted. All is lost.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You call yourself a friend? I was trying to help you, and at the first sign of trouble you ran away, leaving me to fend off a family of rats. You’re a completely selfish human being and a, and a physical and a moral coward.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: His statements of the obvious continue to annoy.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hi-ho, hi-ho, it’s off to fish we go.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: That’s what you’re wearing?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No good? The guy at the sporting goods store said these are what fishermen wear.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: Maybe in cartoons.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Wish I had known that before I posted all those pictures on Facebook.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: All right, let’s hit the road. I wouldn’t mind shooting some ducks in the morning.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Wait, now we’re shooting things?

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: I like using a big shell. You can’t eat them afterwards, but it’s fun watching them blow up.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sir, I’m flattered that you invited me, and I really want you to like me, but I don’t think this trip is the way to do it. And I can’t return these things if there’s chunks of duck all over them.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: So, why’d you agree to come?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: ‘Cause Bernadette made me.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: I tried to back out, too. My wife said I had to go.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Really? Your wife makes you do stuff? You’re a big, scary cop.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: You’re an astronaut, and your wife makes you do things, and she’s only four feet tall.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So, what do we do now? They expect us to go away for the weekend.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: Ah. There’s an Indian casino near Palm Springs. You know how to shoot craps?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, but I’m not a stranger to dice games. I was the Temple Beth-El Hebrew School Yahtzee champion.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: Mazel tov. I’ll teach you how to play.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Really? Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: Call me Mike.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay. Oh, boy, we’re just married to a couple of ballbusters, huh, Mike?

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: That’s my wife and daughter you’re talking about.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Great couple of gals.

turns.speaker: Rostenkowski
turns.transcript: I wouldn’t go that far.

scene: The following morning. Sheldon is in the kitchen making breakfast. He crosses to the couch, sees Penny sleeping there, looks lost. He is about to sit down on Penny when Leonard enters.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Every Saturday since we have lived in this apartment, I have awakened at 6:15, poured myself a bowl of cereal, added a quarter cup of 2% milk, sat on this end of this couch, turned on BBC America and watched Doctor Who.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Penny’s still sleeping.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Every Saturday since we have lived in this apartment, I have awakened at 6:15, poured myself a bowl of cereal….

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I know, I know, look, you have a TV in your room, why don’t you just have breakfast in bed?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because I am neither an invalid nor a woman celebrating Mother’s Day.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, what time is it?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Almost 6:30.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I slept all day?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, no, it’s 6:30 in the morning.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What the hell is your problem?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, this cereal has lost all its molecular integrity, I now have a bowl of shredded wheat paste.

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: Ola, nerd-migos.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Why do you people hate sleep? Are you wearing my robe?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, yeah, sorry, I’ll have it cleaned.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: That’s okay, keep it. Where’s Christie.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: In the shower. Oh, by the way, where did you get that loofah mitt, yours reaches places that mine just won’t.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Y-you used my loofah?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: More precisely we used your loofah. I exfoliated her brains out!

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You can keep that too.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ah, well then we’ll probably need to talk about your stuffed bear collection.

turns.speaker: off)
turns.transcript: Howard?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: In here my lady.

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: Mmmm, there’s my little engine that could.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: chka-chka-chka-chka-chka-chka-chka (they kiss).

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well there’s one beloved children’s book I’ll never read again.

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: Hi, Christie.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Leonard.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: Right, you’re Howard’s entourage.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, so Christie, what are your plans?

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: Oh, well, Howard said he’d take me shopping in Beverley Hills.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, no, I meant plans to find some place to live. Other than with me, not that I don’t love having you, but it’s… a little crowded.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Penny, you’re always welcome to stay with us.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, terrific, now we’re running a cute little B&B.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Let me offer a little outside the box thinking here, why doesn’t Christie stay with me.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: For one thing you live with your mother.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I do not, my mother lives with me.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well then, it’s all settled, Christie will stay with Howard, Penny can go back to her apartment, and I’ll watch the last 24 minutes of Doctor Who, although at this point it’s more like Doctor Why Bother.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon you just can’t dictate…

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No more talking, everybody go.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So, what do you say, you wanna repair to Castle Wolowitz?

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: What is that, like a Mexican deli?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m sorry, I should have mentioned this earlier, my last name is Wolowitz.

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: Oh, that’s so cool. My first Jew!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I imagine there aren’t many kosher corn-huskers.

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: But you’re still taking me shopping, right?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Anything you want.

turns.speaker: Christie
turns.transcript: Okay, I’ll go pack my stuff.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: When they perfect human cloning I’m going to order twelve of those.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Howard, can’t you see she’s using you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Who cares, last night she pulled off her blouse and I wept!

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Look, Howard, I know her, okay, she’ll have sex with anyone as long as they keep buying her things.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yay! If you’ll excuse me, I have some Bar-Mizvah bonds to cash.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I do crap for you all the time. Get out there.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So your wife’s in Arizona with the grandkids?

turns.speaker: Mike
turns.transcript: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You know, my mom’s been to Arizona. She rode one of those mules down in the Grand Canyon. Long story short, they had to shoot it. ‘Cause she’s so fat. I’ll get the door while you finish laughing. Hey, guys.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Happy Thanksgiving.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It smells wonderful. Is anyone slaving away in the kitchen? Because I, too, know…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Here. Thank you for having us.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What’s with you?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, she’s mad at me because she just found out she’s married to Zack.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Really? That dumb-ass she used to date? That’s hysterical.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I can’t believe I felt bad for opening this in the car.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: This train thing worked out better than I thought. He’s home studying the engineer’s manual.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s so peaceful without him here. Can I ask you how much that cost?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Four thousand dollars, worth every penny.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: Gentlemen.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Colonel Williams. Sir.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: Just wanted to see how the guidance system’s coming along.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Great. We found a cooling solution that allowed us to get the size of the prototype down to the target specs.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: As a cooling solution, it’s pretty cool.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: Don’t do that. What’s this?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, nothing. Just some math we don’t need.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: This is a different approach. Are you trying to get the guidance system even smaller?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s just a theory. Uh, it’s not even worked out.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: Oh. I want this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: But we’ve already met the agreed upon specs. Going smaller would require weeks’ worth of new computations.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: So get the kid with the two shirts to do it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sir, uh, if I may, uh, we’ve put a lot of thought and effort into this current prototype. It’s a really elegant solution, and most importantly, it works.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: Yeah, I want this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, but that’s just a theory. It’s not even a complete thought.

turns.speaker: Williams
turns.transcript: You both make excellent points, and thank you for presenting it so articulately. Make this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: The kid with the two shirts screwed us again.

scene: The Renaissance Fair. The guys are in costume. Sheldon is Spock and has a tri-corder.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Captain, I’m getting an unusual reading.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, that’s great, you guys want corn dogs?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s a temporal anomaly. Corn dogs didn’t come into existence until the first half of the twentieth century.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I think I’m gonna go home.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Why? I really don’t understand what’s happening here.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You know, Sheldon, at any other time, learning that you had plans to go live on Mars would be a slow news day. But a couple of hours ago, we were getting a turtle. And silly as it sounds, I thought that meant something.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Amy. Oh, why didn’t I give her Sleepy Time tea? Amy, wait. Getting a turtle meant a great deal to me, too.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sure. Unless something better comes along.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Do you want me to withdraw my application?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What I want is for us to be planning our future together.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And in that future, are we on the same planet? Because I’ve seen people make the long-distance thing work.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: We’re on the same planet.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. Does that planet have to be Earth?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Are you asking me to go to Mars with you?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I am. Yeah, if I’m going to a barren, lifeless environment where the chances of survival are slim to none, I want you there with me. Why don’t we go back to the apartment, and fill out your application?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay. I suppose being the first people on a new planet would be incredibly exciting.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I know. We could be the first to plant a flag on Mars. We could be the first to watch Mars Attacks! on Mars. We could be the first to say good lord, what on Mars are you talking about?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You know, we could also be the first people to procreate on Mars.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You just can’t keep it in your space pants, can you?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Think about it. If we had a family there, our kids would be Martians.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: They would, wouldn’t they? We could give them cool Martian names. And we could teach them about Martian history. Like, who planted those flags? And, uh, where did that copy of Mars Attacks! come from?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I guess we’ll have to make a new video together, as a couple.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good idea. And since you’ve had such a rough day, I’m gonna let you throw the pie in Leonard’s face.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You know, it’s nice to spend time with people who don’t talk about work like it’s some kind of soap opera.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Jennifer still trying to sleep her way to the top?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You should be happy someone wants to do the stuff with Penny you don’t want to.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah, I wish I had that with Howard.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Wait. What? What do I make you do?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Let’s see, the magic store, the Doctor Who convention, the National Belt Buckle Collector’s meet and greet.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It said right there on the invitation, buckle up for fun. It’s not my fault you didn’t listen.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m sure I’m overreacting.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You’re entitled to feel how you feel. If you don’t like it, you should just talk to her.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t want to sound like a jealous baby.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Oh, then maybe you shouldn’t talk to her.

turns.speaker: Voice
turns.transcript: Before we begin your guided meditation, close your eyes and picture yourself in a peaceful environment.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. I’m inside the CERN super collider.

turns.speaker: Voice
turns.transcript: Now, take a deep, relaxing breath in through your nose. And let it out.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wow. Didn’t see that coming.

turns.speaker: Voice
turns.transcript: In.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Let me guess.

turns.speaker: Voice
turns.transcript: And out.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What was I gonna do? Two ins in a row? Where’s my lemonade?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I didn’t get it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: A fitting swan song to your career as a waitress, to forget my order one last time.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Do you think quitting my job was a mistake?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Do you see me drinking lemonade?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No. I’m serious.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Because Leonard just pissed me off. Am I being an idiot or not?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, I don’t think you are.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: The best way to achieve a goal is to devote 100% of your time and energy to it. When I decided I was going to be a physicist, I didn’t take some other job in case it didn’t work out. Which wasn’t easy because there was a lot of pressure from Ms. Pearson for me to be chalk monitor that year.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Thank you. I needed to hear that. Why can’t Leonard understand it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because he’s not like us, Penny. We’re dreamers.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, I need to start cracking the window when I leave you in the car.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I guess I just miss when life was simpler.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So what happened? How’d it go?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s fine. I thanked them again and let them know we’re not available.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So I can drink this without having to give up the goodies?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yes, it’s all cool. Although, if you wanted to talk to one of them, no one would blame you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: And why would no one blame me?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I don’t know what I’m saying.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, it sounds like you’re saying that I could do better than Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Boy, these drinks are strong. Hoo, mama, I’m gonna be huggin’ the toilet tonight.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No, tell me, I want to know what you meant by that.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I just meant that you’re not married and your boyfriend’s kind of, Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: And your husband is extremely Howard. What’s your point?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Sorry. I have no point. That was a stupid thing to say. Can we please just go back to having a nice time?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: We could, but unfortunately my brain is lesion-free and I remember that rotten thing you just said about my sweet baboo.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Come on. I apologize. Can we please just let it go?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Thanks.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Your husband’s weird and his clothes are ridiculous.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: That’s a kick. That’s an actual kick.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I felt a kick. There’s a baby in there.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Oh, yeah, that’s where I put it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, I mean, I know you’re pregnant. I just never connected the idea of pregnancy and you actually having a baby.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Which MIT did you go to?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, God, we are not ready to have an infant in this house. We don’t have a crib, we don’t have diapers, we’re not baby-proofed. Anyone can just walk in off the street and lift our toilet lids!

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howie, we have time to do all that stuff.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Do we? Look at you. Willy Wonka would roll you to the juicing room.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: The next person kicking you will be me. Good night.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Are we even in a good school…? Ow!

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I warned you, and I did it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, Stuart, have you seen Sheldon?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Yeah, he’s, uh, over in the graphic novel section. Built himself a little nest.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Uh, Penny?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Uh, Sheldon told me you and Leonard were having a fight?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, yeah, kind of. It’s, it’s no big thing.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, good, good. (She moves away) I love you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m not leaving until you talk to me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: All right, what’s going on?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s a little hard to explain. He does this thing where he pretends he’s in an alternate dimension that occupies the same physical space we’re in, but he can’t perceive us.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Don’t flatter yourself. I’m just ignoring you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Come on, Sheldon, let’s go home. Look, we’re done fighting.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’ve heard that before, but then, the next thing you know I’m hiding in my bedroom, blaring a Richard Feinman lecture while my mom is shouting that Jesus would forgive her if she put ground glass in my dad’s meatloaf, and my dad’s on the roof skeet-shooting her Franklin Mint collectible plates.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, there’s going to no more shouting and no skeet-shooting.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Really? Where’s your friend Justin going to sleep?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, where’s he gonna sleep?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, my God, would you let this go?!

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I’d let it go.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why should I let it go? Why don’t you just tell the guy to find another place to sleep? (Sheldon turns on a loud toy robot) Oh, for God’s sakes. So, you have childhood issues, we all have childhood issues, at some point, you just need to grow up and get past them. (Sheldon turns on another robot)

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Leonard, will you just let me handle this, please? Look, let’s just… Sheldon, please,

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Always is a long time. Sure. Always.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You know, how about we buy you this robot, and then we all go home?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I want that one.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, you can have that one.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, come on, he’s just going to play with it twice, and then it’ll end up in his closet with all the other junk.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Buy him the robot, Leonard.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Can I get this comic book, too?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes, you can.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: We meet again.

turns.speaker: Dimitri
turns.transcript: Hey, Froot Loops. You got a phone call.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Who is it?

turns.speaker: Dimitri
turns.transcript: A woman who says she’s your mother but sounds like your father.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey, Ma. You know, we could see each other if you turn on the computer.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: I’m not going near that fakakta thing. I’ll catch a computer virus.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You can’t catch a computer virus.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Oh, so now you’re an astronaut and a doctor?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What do you want, Ma?

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Your wife says you have something important to tell me.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, here it is. Bernadette and I are starting a life together and…

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Oh, God! You are gonna leave me.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ma…

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: It’s okay. Your father left me, you left me, I guess I’m just the kind of person people like to leave.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s not definite. I’ll talk to Bernadette.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Don’t bother. I’ll just go sit in a hole in the ground so I’m no trouble when I die.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Stop it, Ma. I’m sure I can get Bernie to come around.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: I knew it. I knew she was behind this. You listen to me, if you want to be a man you can’t let a woman tell you what to do.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: Dimitri
turns.transcript: Oy. I can’t believe these people won the Cold War.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Now, can we please change the subject?

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Fine. Explain why you’ve been gone so long and I haven’t gotten a single letter. Not even a lousy postcard.

turns.speaker: Skype)
turns.transcript: Hi, Sheldon. What’s up?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good news. You’re an asteroid.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Uh, please tell me what to say next.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Perhaps I should explain. While working with Koothrappali, we discovered an asteroid, and I named it after you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Oh. Sheldon, thank you. That’s so romantic. But what about Rajesh? He was okay with you choosing the name?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, it took a little negotiating, but I wore him down. Uh, we get the asteroid, and if you and I have children, they all have to be named Rajesh.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: All of them?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Even the girls.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay, I think I know what to say now.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Oh, great. This again.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Arthur, what brings you back?

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Uh, beats me. I, I just hope this isn’t a, a sex dream.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: In the past, you’ve come to me when I’m struggling with a dilemma.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: And, and the one time where, where you were afraid, and you needed me for, for a night light. What’s, what’s troubling you?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, my friends are telling me I shouldn’t abandon my girlfriend on her birthday to see the new Star Wars movie.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Well, sounds right. Can, can I get out of this muumuu now?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Those are the robes of the Jedi, the guardians of peace and justice in the galaxy.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: And they, they, they don’t wear underwear.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: So, you agree with my friends that I should skip the premiere?

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Uh, do, do you love this girl?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. But she knows how important Star Wars is to me.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Well, maybe you should show her how, how important she is to you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: By seeing the movie she’d want me to see?

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Sheldon, you, you can see this movie whenever you want. But you only have a limited number of days that you, you can be with this woman. Be with her.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re right.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Great.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: I don’t know, but hopefully, somewhere I can wear pants.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Isn’t this nice?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, we’re here.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Alfred. Thank you for coming!

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: Oh. Well, happy to be here. And congratulations.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Dad, you remember Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Dr. Hofstadter.

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: Dr. Cooper.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: This is Sheldon’s mother, Mary.

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: How do you do?

turns.speaker: Mary
turns.transcript: Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And his girlfriend, Amy.

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: A pleasure.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hi.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And, of course, Mom.

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: Hello, my hateful shrew.

turns.speaker: Beverly
turns.transcript: Hello to you, you wrinkled old bastard.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, now I’m starting to sense a little tension.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: All right, you two, don’t start. Penny and I are throwing this second wedding for your benefit. Can you please not ruin it?

turns.speaker: Alfred
turns.transcript: Of course. I’m sorry.

turns.speaker: Beverly
turns.transcript: Oh, look at that, you can apologize.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Mom.

turns.speaker: Beverly
turns.transcript: I’m sorry.

turns.speaker: Mary
turns.transcript: You know, the Bible says forgiveness…

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mom.

turns.speaker: Mary
turns.transcript: I’m sorry.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, who’s hungry? We have a reservation at the best restaurant in town.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It only got three-and-a-half stars on Yelp.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m not sorry. That’s true.

scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Watch your fingers. Watch your fingers. Oh God, my fingers!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You okay?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, it hurt… (looking around) Great Caesar’s Ghost, look at this place?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So Penny’s a little messy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: A little messy? The Mandelbrot set of complex numbers is a little messy, this is chaos. Excuse me, explain to me an organisational system where a tray of flatware on a couch is valid. I’m just inferring that this is a couch, because the evidence suggests the coffee table’s having a tiny garage sale.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Did it ever occur to you that not everyone has the compulsive need to sort, organise and label the entire world around them?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well they don’t. Hard as it may be for you to believe, most people don’t sort their breakfast cereal numerically by fibre content.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Excuse me, but I think we’ve both found that helpful at times.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Come on, we should go.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hang on.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Straightening up.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, this is not your home.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: This is not anyone’s home, this is a swirling vortex of entropy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: When the transvestite lived here, you didn’t care how he kept the place.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because it was immaculate, I mean, you open that man’s closet, it was left to right, evening gowns, cocktail dresses, then his police uniforms.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What were you doing in his closet?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I helped run some cable for a webcam.

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: Hey guys.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, hey Penny, this just arrived, we just brought this up, just now.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Great. Was it hard getting it up the stairs?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: (sucks in breath)

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, we’ll get out of your hair.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, great, thank you again (she throws her jacket over the back of the sofa).

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Penny, I just want you to know that, you don’t have to live like this. I’m here for you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What’s he talking about?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s a joke.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I don’t get it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, he didn’t tell it right.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What you working on?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m writing an appeal to the Faculty Senate, so that I can move on from string theory.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh. How’s it going?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You tell me. Dear Esteemed Colleagues, as you may know, I have requested to change my field of study. My decision to do so is, I believe, in the best interest of science. At your convenience, I’d be happy to explain it to you in words you’ll understand.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s nice that you called them esteemed.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re right. I’ll take that out.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, listen, there was something I was hoping to float past you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mm.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Now that Penny and I are engaged, I thought we might want to talk about our living arrangements.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Of course. She’s spent many nights here, and you’re worried about preserving the myth of her virginity before the wedding.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m not.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good, because not only has that ship sailed, if it hit an iceberg, countless men would perish.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Actually, this is about where she and I are going to live.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, well, we might want to live together.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, yeah, well, I’ve already given this some thought, and I’m willing to let Penny live with us one day a week for a trial period. Now, obviously, not when she’s made cranky by the shedding of her uterine lining.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That’s very sweet. But we were thinking more of us maybe living together with… not you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I don’t understand. How could we all live together if I’m not there?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Look, I, I know this is, this is change, and that sounds scary.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Where are you going to go?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t know. We just started to think about this. Maybe I’ll move in with Penny, or maybe she and I’ll take this place, and you can move across the hall.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Move across the hall? Did you take a marijuana?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, I did not.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Did you get hit on the head with a coconut?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, then, I’m all out of guesses. What? Me move across the hall. Why would you even suggest such a thing?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Because I love Penny, and want to give her the life she deserves.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I see. You’re putting your future bride’s happiness above mine.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wow.

scene: Living room, Sheldon is sleeping on the sofa, with his head on Lesley’s Violin case.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Big boy! (Wakes up, looks at watch, wraps self in blanket, walks towards kitchen) Someone touched my board. Oh God, my board. Leonard! Leonard!

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: Hey, what’s the matter?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: My equations, someone’s tampered with my equations.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Of course I’m sure. Look at the beta-function of quantum chrono-dynamics, the sign’s been changed.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh yeah. But doesn’t that fix the problem you’ve been having?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Are you insane? Are you out of your mind? Are you…. hey look, that fixes the problem I’ve been having.

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: You’re welcome.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You did this?

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: Yeah, I noticed it when I got up to get a glass of water, so I fixed it, now you can show that quarks are asymptotically free at high energies. Pretty cool, huh?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Cool?

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: Listen, I got to hit the lab. Thanks for a great night.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you, I’ll see you at work.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Uh-duh, hold on, hold on!

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Who told you you could touch my board?

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: No-one.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I don’t come into your house and touch your board.

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: There are no incorrect equations on my board.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, that is so… so…

turns.speaker: Lesley
turns.transcript: I’m sorry, I’ve got to run, if you come up with an adjective, text me. (Leaves).

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Inconsiderate, that is the adjective, inconsiderate.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Stuart.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Morning.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: We talked about this. I don’t mind you still living here, but we got to have some rules. And rule number one is pants.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Dan
turns.transcript: So, why do you think you’d make a good pharmaceutical sales rep?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, I’m a people person. People like me. Some of my favourite people are people. I feel like I’m saying people a lot. People, people, people. Okay, I’m done.

turns.speaker: Dan
turns.transcript: You sure?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: People. Yes.

turns.speaker: Dan
turns.transcript: Good. So, how do you feel your previous job experience has prepared you for a career like this?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, well, as a waitress, sales was a big part of my job. I mean, believe me, I convinced a lot of very large customers, who should not be eating cheesecake, to have more cheesecake. I mean, one of those chubsters even had an insulin pump.

turns.speaker: Dan
turns.transcript: Uh-huh. I have an insulin pump.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: People.

scene: Raj’s apartment. Lucy is looking through Raj’s telescope.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: If you look carefully at Venus, you should be able to see the International Space Station pass by.

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: Wow. Your friend was actually up there?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yeah. He brought me back a T-shirt that said My Friend Went to the Space Station and All I Got Was This Lousy T-Shirt

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: Did he take the T-shirt to space?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Nope. It’s exactly as lousy as advertised. Speaking of friends, they have been asking to meet you. I was thinking maybe we could all hang out sometime?

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: I don’t know. How many are there?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Let’s see. Six. That’s pretty cool, I have six friends. Kind of like Sinatra.

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: Six strangers? That’s a lot of pressure. Staring at me, asking me personal questions. Like, what do you do? Where are you from? Why did you lock yourself in the bathroom?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Okay, how about you just dip your toe in and meet one of them?

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: Will you be there?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Of course.

turns.speaker: Lucy
turns.transcript: Well, that’s two. Three if you count me. Oh, this is getting out of hand.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Look, I get it, this is still my room, we haven’t really made it yours.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Which is why I got you this Pink Power Ranger. Put it anywhere you like.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, but you may feel some discomfort.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m kidding, I want you to feel at home here. Decorate it any way that makes you happy.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Do you really mean that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I really do.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Great, and just so you know, I’m not getting rid of all your stuff.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah? What are you keeping?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: That candle and you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What about my robot poster?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uhbubububuh, I can make do with just the candle.

scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a card game.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Gelatinous Sphere.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Focused Locust.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Temple of Yip.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m sorry. Wolowitz would never play that card.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: All right, Lesser Demon Turtle.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Fairy God Monster, I win. Your desperate need for friendship makes you weak.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: So, what are you guys doing later? Stuart and I were thinking of going out for a drink.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: We’re gonna try to meet some girls.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: ‘Cause that’s what we do.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Watch out, ladies, a little coffee and cream coming your way.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: In case you didn’t follow that, I’m the coffee.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Leonard? Maybe you’d like to go with them to meet girls.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why would I be interested? I have Penny.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, for now. But that woman has a death wish, Leonard. She talks to strangers, she pets unfamiliar dogs, and it is ridiculously easy to break into her apartment. If I were you, I’d get a back-up.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You can’t just replace someone you care about with some other random person.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: No, please don’t ruin this for me.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Do you remember how upset I was when they replaced Edward Norton as the Hulk?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yes, you walked around for a week saying, Sheldon unhappy with casting choice.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: But, then Mark Ruffalo was the Hulk in The Avengers, and he was even better.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What’s your point?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Call me a romantic. I like to think that your Mark Ruffalo is still out there somewhere.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: This is ridiculous. Are we gonna play cards or not?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I like Mark Ruffalo, too.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, settle down there, fake Wolowitz. No one likes a kiss-up.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I brought sparkling cider.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, the bubbles tickle my nose. I’ll just open this now so it can get nice and flat before we drink it.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: So what do you want to do tonight?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I have quite the evening planned. Our foetus-friendly festival of fun begins with an in-depth look at the world of model trains, and then we’ll kick things up a notch and explore all the different ways that you can make toast.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: There’s more than one?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’ve heard of French toast?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Cinnamon toast?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Melba toast?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You get where I’m going here?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: All I’m saying is if they can cure yellow fever and malaria, why can’t they do something about lactose intolerance?

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Leonard, you’re going to have to let this go. You had a little cheese dip, you farted, I thought it was cute.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, hi Stephanie.

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Hi.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Want some more wine?

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Yeah, I assume I’m not driving anywhere tonight. (Sheldon lets out a loud noise).

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I have a craving for white asparagus that apparently is destined to go unsatisfied.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Excuse me. What the hell is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m helping you with Stephanie.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: By making constipated moose sounds?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: When I fail to open this jar and you succeed it will establish you as the alpha male. You see, when a female witnesses an exhibition of physical domination she produces the hormone oxytocin. If the two of you then engage in intercourse this will create the biochemical reaction in the brain which lay people naively interpret as falling in love.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Huh? Would it work if I just punched you in the face?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, actually it would, but let’s see how the lid goes. I’m not strong enough, Leonard, you’ll have to do it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, for god’s sakes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Go ahead, it’s pre-loosened.

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Do you want some help with that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, no, no, I got it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, yeah, yeah, he’s got it, and that’s not surprising. This is something I long ago came to peace with in my role as the beta male. Open it. (Leonard tries again. Then taps jar on counter. Jar breaks.)

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Oh my god, are you okay?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, I’m not. I’m bleeding.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Like a gladiator!

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Oh, honey, you’re going to need stitches.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Stitches? With a needle?

turns.speaker: Steph
turns.transcript: Well, yeah, I mean, just a few.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, okay, yeah, hang on a sec. (Throws up in sink)

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: FYI, I was defrosting a steak in there.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: All right.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, this is already better. There are far fewer distractions in here.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Plus, this is where our minds are conditioned to focus on work.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, I’ve been thinking about the hover boards, and maybe there’s a way we could use Maglev technology.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Or if we could figure out a way to supercool the materials, we could utilize quantum coupling.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I wonder if anyone’s tried that.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Go online and look it up.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, I can’t argue with him. It’s right there on the screen. Austria does look like a wiener.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: That’s nothing, dude. Go check out how hung Florida is.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m sure Mrs. Florida’s walking funny. Can we get back to work?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, he’s right. Oh, here’s a thought. What if we use some form of operant conditioning techniques to keep us from getting off topic?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Like behavior modification?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, exactly. Did you know those techniques were used to actually teach pigeons to play ping-pong?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: That cannot be true.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey, it was match point.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Some psychologists perform operant conditioning with punishment. Maybe we can come up with a punishment for straying off topic.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Not getting to see who wins at pigeon ping-pong comes to mind.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: We could snap a rubber band on our wrists every time we get sidetracked.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mmm, not bad. You know, in medieval times, idle chatter was punished with a device called the scold’s bridle. It’s an iron cage that’s locked around the head and pierces the tongue.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: If only we had one.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I’ll check Amazon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Penny, Leonard. Would you be able to answer some questions I’m having about the events of last night?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Question one, where are my pants?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You might want to check YouTube.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What do I search?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s already loaded. Just hit play.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, people, let’s get down to the math. It is only three dimensional thinking that limits our imagination. Can I take my pants off over my head? Of course not. My body’s in the way. But if we had access to higher dimensions, we could move our pants around our bodies through the fourth dimension and our days of dropping trousers would be over.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, Lord, this couldn’t be any more humiliating.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh-uh, give it a minute.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Now, for the astronomers in the audience, get ready to see the dark side of the moon. And here’s Uranus.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Let’s see. What’s young and fun? Uh, we could go dancing.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you actually gonna dance?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Of course.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah. No one wants to see that. Hey, how about skinny dipping at the beach?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, I don’t need any fish nibbling my business.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, there’s a screening of Moulin Rouge, I heard the crowd sings along and stuff.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That sounds fun. When’s it start?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Midnight.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Midnight. Really? You know what? Let’s do it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, great. Oh, wait. Uh, it’s sold out.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, thank God.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Gentlemen.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Nurse’s office.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Asthma attack?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Asthma, heart, some kind of attack. I’m fine, though.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You guys going to Professor Tupperman’s memorial?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I don’t know.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Probably not.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Barely knew him.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah, you wouldn’t want to look like you guys are brown-nosing the tenure committee, who will all be there. Oh, yeah, that’s what I was hoping for, meerkats.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Is there a reason I had to leave my own apartment?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, I think they just want you to see it for the first time all decorated.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: But who’s gonna tell them they’re doing it wrong?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, I’m, I’m sure they’ll ask you to give a speech, and that’s when you just tear ’em a new one. Have to say, you, you do look good in that suit.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh. Thank you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Maybe later I’ll, uh, get to see you in your birthday suit.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: But this is my birthday suit. Are you having a stroke? Because that’s the kind of thing that just ruins a birthday party.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I don’t know what Emily’s so upset about anyway. Even if I had slept with him, so what? Everyone has a past.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hmm-hmm.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Almost everyone has a past.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Come on, look how pretty you are. I’m sure this isn’t the first girl to hate you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It’s not.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: And I’m sure you can turn it around.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: How? You can’t force someone to like you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What if you just hang around and act like her friend until you wear her down? I mean, next thing you know, you’re in her home, you’re eating her food, drinking her wine.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No, that won’t work.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You’re right. Cheers.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Oh, I know. Why don’t you use your sales training to go back down there and sell yourself?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah. But instead of selling a drug, you’d be selling Penny. it’s cute.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It’s stupid.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, maybe people would like you more if you didn’t crap all over their ideas.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I’m gonna go with Penny on this one. Then again, why wouldn’t I? I mean, we go way back.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, my God. I didn’t used to like you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Shh. Amy’s here now.

scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mm. I want to build a road, but I need wood. Do either of you fellows have wood? (Raj and Howard snigger) I don’t understand the laughter. The object of Settlers of Catan is to build roads and settlements. To do so requires wood. Now, I have sheep; I need wood. Who has wood for my sheep?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, how do I look?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, more to the point, why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Did you forget what Penny did to you? It took you two years and defiling my sister to turn that frown upside down.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I didn’t defile your sister, we had a relationship.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I heard you call her Brown Sugar. In my book, that’s defilement.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You want to know my opinion?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, boy, do I?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Sarcasm?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, then. The reason you’re fixated on a good-natured simpleton like Penny is that she’s the exact opposite of your first romantic attachment, your brilliant yet intimidating mother.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Where on earth did you get that from?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s in her book, Needy Baby, Greedy Baby.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That doesn’t make it true.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s called non-fiction for a reason, Leonard.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: See you later.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: If they ever make a movie version of that book, you know who should play Leonard’s mother? Sandra Bullock.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Why?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Because she’s great in everything.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Now, where were we? Oh, yes. Does anyone have any wood? Oh, come on! I just want wood. Why are you making it so hard?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Ooh, the philharmonic is playing Beethoven downtown.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Before you say yes, it’s not the movie about the big dog.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: How come we can’t think of something we both want to do?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Because you always pick what we do and I just go along with it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Ah, interesting, we’re being accused of making you do things you don’t like, and here you are, doing the same thing to poor Amy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You should point out the hypocrisy of that.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That’s what I was doing.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, that wasn’t clear. Try it again, but this time drive it home with how do you like them apples, Missy?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: All right, keep thinking.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re making it too complicated. Why not stick to the basics? Go shopping for clothes while Leonard and I sit in those uncomfortable chairs and hold your purses, hmm? I know I’d hate that. Leonard?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, yeah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, then, it’s settled?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What do you say? Sounds kind of perfect.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It does, somehow he managed to take all the fun out of it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, once again, it’s what I do.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Sorry you guys had to see that.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, don’t apologize.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. It just makes it a lot harder to pretend it never happened.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Money’s a sensitive subject for Howie because of the difference in our income.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It really bothers him?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, sure. There’s still a lot of pressure on guys to be providers. So even though he’s happy for me, it’s just a little tough on him.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, if I do well in sales, I could end up making a lot more money than you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Not a problem. I grew up with a mother who emasculated my father financially and in every other aspect of his life, so really, it’s what I think love looks like.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’ll be right back. I’m gonna go check on him.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Maybe it’s a good thing we came here. It’s like a lesson in what not to do.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah I don’t want something dumb like money to come between us.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It won’t. Let’s just promise to figure this kind of stuff out before we get married.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Why are you being so bossy?

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Why are you being a baby?

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: I’m not a baby. I’m a grown man, and I made the bed. Now where’s my star?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Should we go?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hang on. I want to see if he gets the star.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: To wine and bubble wrap. And to not having to watch Sheldon demonstrate his reverse osmosis machine that converts urine into drinking water.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You know, in Girl Scouts, Tammie Dinisha said you could do that with panty hose. Boy, was she wrong. Anyway, you want to make out?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I thought because our relationship’s in a beta test, you wanted to take things slow.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay. Do you want to make out slow?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I can go so slow it’ll be like there’s a snail in your mouth.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ugh. Well, lucky for you, there’s nothing else to do right now.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Excuse me, Leonard.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Since when don’t you knock? It’s like the only good thing about you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Social niceties have been suspended, Leonard. We’re in a state of a emergency. The world has descended into darkened turmoil. Lawlessness and savagery are the order of the day.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Fine, what is it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m making s’mores. I wanted to alert you in case you smelled caramelizing marshmallows and thought a nearby candy factory was on fire.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: S’mores, huh? Good for you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, or good for us if you sign here and reinstate the full roommate agreement.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, thanks. I’m good.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Really? Huh! Okay. In that case, I will have a s’more by myself. And then I’m gonna have s’more. By myself.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Aw.

turns.speaker: Leonard

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, he’s crazy. Sometimes crazy looks like sad so it’ll suck you back in.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I think he misses his little buddy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Fine. But mark my words, this frustrating, bogus teenage make-out session is not over.

scene: The living room. Sheldon is surrounded by whiteboards.

turns.speaker: (excitedly)
turns.transcript: I’ve got it! I finally reconciled the black hole information paradox with my theory of string-network condensates!

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: It’s unbelievable! It’s paradigm-altering!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And I could not have done it without you.

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: Oh, please, I just offered a little encouragement.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It was a lot more than that. You helped me work out the masses of all the fermions, and you pumiced my hammer toe. How can I ever repay you?

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: Well, would you consider naming it the Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Who’s Nowitzki?

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: I’m Nowitzki.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, you want me to share credit?

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Get out!

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: I’m so glad that you and I were able to bury the hatchet.

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: Me, too. And I respect your right to your beliefs.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: And I will pray for you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, Mom, let’s get you back to your hotel before anyone says anything else.

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: One moment. There’s something I need to say to you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, really? That’s too bad.

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: Leonard, I always made you earn my affection, but today I realize that there’s more than one way to raise a child.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I taught her that.

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: Therefore, I would like to initiate a new protocol wherein I shower you with unconditional love.

turns.transcript: Wow. When does that start?

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: So needy. Come to Mommy.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It’s okay, go ahead.

turns.speaker: Hofstadter
turns.transcript: Oh, my son.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, my mother.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Good morning, handsome.

turns.transcript: Morning, Mom.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s me.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yes, it is, and you’re so pretty in the morning.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Your mom and I made you breakfast.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, wow. So you guys are getting along?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah, I guess. We’re very different people, Howard, so communication’s a little tricky.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Does he like the pancakes?!

turns.speaker: voice)
turns.transcript: He didn’t try them yet!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Is there any butter?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s butter-flavoured syrup.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: So, what’s the word?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: He wants butter!

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: It’s butter-flavoured syrup

turns.transcript: I just told him that!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t need any butter.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: If you want butter, I’ll get you butter.

turns.transcript: Well, I guess I’ll cut these by myself.

turns.transcript: Mm. Hello, Daddy. What’s up?

turns.speaker: Koothrapalli
turns.transcript: Not much, just wanted to see how my son’s doing.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Very well, thank you.

turns.speaker: Koothrapalli
turns.transcript: Are you still dating that dermatologist?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: If you could feel how soft my skin is, you wouldn’t have to ask.
