turns.transcript: I’m sneaking into work. Now, if the guard at the university asks what’s under the blanket, you tell him it’s some lobster traps.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Lobster traps?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. That’s how Velma and Scooby smuggled Shaggy into the old lighthouse.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you going to do when you get to the university? People are going to recognize you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Will they, Leonard? (Puts on cap and long-hair wig)

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Fine. Just get back under your blanket, and I’ll drive you there.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And no more singing.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Fine.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I have GPS on my phone. I know you turned around.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Boy, last time I put VapoRub on you, you didn’t have hair on your chest.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I know, it filled in last year. I didn’t get to spend a lot of time with you on this visit.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: And whose fault was that?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yours.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Shelly, you’re not eight years old any more. We have to have a different relationship.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, we don’t. The one we have works great.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Sweetheart, you are a grown man.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Or maybe I’m part of a new species, that lives for hundreds of years, which means I’m still basically a toddler.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Oh, I so should have taken you to Houston.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Does this mean you’re not going to sing Soft Kitty?

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: No, I will always sing you Soft Kitty. (Sings) Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…

turns.speaker: door)
turns.transcript: Mrs. Cooper, were we supposed to take that pie out of the oven?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Get out!

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Well, that was rude.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I know, but he means well. Sing.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Happy kitty, sleepy kitty…

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What are you trying to pull, Mom? From the top.

turns.speaker: God)
turns.transcript: This is what I’m talking about. (Sings) Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I checked the App Store. No one is doing handwriting-recognition differential equation solving.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, dear Lord, shush.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You have so few good ideas, Leonard. And you’re just going to spill the beans in front of an outsider?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Who, me?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, I don’t think Penny cares about handwriting-recognition based differential…

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: The stars at night are big and bright, deep in the heart of Texas.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: She’s not going to steal our idea.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What idea?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We’re gonna write an application…

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: The prairie sky is wide and high, deep in the heart…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, stop, stop!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Of Texas.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Whatever your secret is, I’m sure it’s boring, so I’m not interested.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s not boring at all. You see, in higher order mathematics, there are certain sets of equations that…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Bored.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Satisfied?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hardly. Consider this unlikely but very plausible scenario. A young woman alone in the big city. Her ridiculous dream of becoming an actress lies shattered about her.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hey, wait a minute.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, hang on. Let’s see where he’s going.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Then it hits her. How is she going to survive? I mean, she has no prospects, no marketable skills. And then one day, she meets a group of geniuses and their friend Howard.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey, I…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hang on. Let’s see where he’s going.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: She befriends them, and then lies in wait until they reveal a marketable idea, which she steals and sells to the highest bidder.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, is it? Well let’s see you come up with an explanation as to why this woman hangs out with us all the time.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, great. You know what? I’ve already mooched dinner off you guys. I don’t need to listen to this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: There’s your answer, free food.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, I’ve taken the liberty of drafting these workflow charts which outline our various duties and the path we will follow as we develop our ground-breaking new app.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey, why am I in charge of phone support? Seems a bit racist.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: A customer service representative with an Indian accent will create the impression we’re a vast enterprise that uses overseas call centres.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh. Very clever. But still racist.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Duly noted, Steve from Wichita.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Why am I listed as your executive assistant?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because the word secretary has fallen into disrepute. FYI, my mother’s birthday is coming up. I’m going to need you to pick up a present.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, we need to stop for a minute.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Leonard, please, we can talk during our break. We have one coming up at midnight. We’ll need snacks.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, you’re not in charge. It’s my idea. I’m in charge.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, of course you are. Look at the organizational chart. You’re clearly listed as founder.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, yes, and you’re listed as Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You missed Chief Science Officer, Chairman of the Board, and Head of the Secret Santa Committee.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay. You need to get clear on this right now. I am in charge of this project.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Ooh. Leonard’s going all alpha nerd on Sheldon’s ass.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right. All right, I’m not going to argue with you. Sheldon Cooper is nothing if not a team player. Dr. Hofstadter, you have the conn.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you. I thought we might start by talking about the user interface.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, dear Lord, we’re doomed.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hello?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What the hell is wrong with you? You told Sheldon? Do you know what a terrible position this puts me in? (Phone beeps)

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hang on, please. Hello?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, just a heads-up: Penny knows that you blabbed about Leonard. She’s pretty mad.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I know. She’s yelling at me right now.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right then, so we’re all on the same page. Yes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: How ya doin’, buddy?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I was humiliated on national radio. How do you think I’m doing?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Come on, it wasn’t that bad.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What do you want?

turns.speaker: voice)
turns.transcript: We represent the Lollipop Guild, and we want you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, so Kripke played a joke on you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It wasn’t funny.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I thought it was funny.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Raj.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You laughed.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Did you laugh?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I fell on the floor. All right, he got you, you can get him back.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I refuse to sink to his level.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You can’t sink. With all that helium in you, you’re lucky you don’t float away.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you really admitting defeat?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I never admit defeat.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Good.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: However, on an unrelated topic, I am never getting out of this bed again.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What if you could make Kripke look even sillier than he made you look?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I don’t think that’s possible, dude.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You’re not helping.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I didn’t come to help, I came to mock.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, what you need to do is figure out a way to exact vengeance on Kripke, like, uh, like, how the Joker got back at Batman for putting him in the Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: That’s true. He didn’t just stay there and talk about his feelings with the other psychotic villains. He, he broke out and poisoned Gotham’s water supply.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I suppose I could poison Kripke.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, no.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s a simple matter. There are several toxic chemicals that’d be untraceable in an autopsy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, uh, that’s the spirit, but, um, let’s dial it back to a non-lethal form of vengeance.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh! How about we put awhoopee cushion on his office chair? He’ll sit down, it’ll sound like he’s flatulent, even though he’s not.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Let’s keep thinking.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I recently read that during World War Two, Joseph Stalin had a research program to create supersoldiers by having women impregnated by gorillas.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What a sick use of science.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey, as long as the baby’s healthy.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I wonder if Stalin considered any other animals.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hippos are the deadliest creature. A half-human, half-hippo soldier would be pretty badass.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yes, but when they’re hungry-hungry, you can stop them with marbles.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, the correct animal for interspecies supersolider is koala. You would wind up with an army so cute it couldn’t be attacked.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: But half-man, half-owl could fly…

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: The answer is cuddly soldiers with big flat noses. Moving on.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So, Penny, when’s the new job start?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Next Monday.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Did you get a chance to look over the materials I gave you?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, not yet, but I will.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Great. When?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I said I’ll get to it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m sensing awkwardness, am I right?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Swish.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I don’t want to be pushy, but you’ve never done pharmaceutical sales before. It seems like you could use this time to get a head start.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, the first few weeks will be all training. They’ll tell me everything I need to know.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: But imagine how impressed they’d be if you showed up already familiar with the material.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, so what, you want me to be like a teacher’s pet?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Couldn’t hurt.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Mm, I don’t know. Who here has ever been hurt because they were the teacher’s pet?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It was like the rest of the class wanted Ms. McDonald to forget the quiz.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I mean, the whole experience reminded me about how much I hated about that world. You, you know, the anxiety, the depression, the negativity. I don’t want to feel those things. I want to sell drugs to people who feel those things.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I can’t believe you got up and walked out of an audition for a big movie.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I did. I mean, I walked in, read for the part, then stunk up the place, but then I walked right out.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, I’m glad you have a new appreciation for your job.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I do, and you know, I don’t think I’ve ever thanked you properly for helping me get it.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Properly, at all. It’s just words I’ve never heard.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, thank you. You’re a good friend, and you changed my life.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You’re welcome. Hey, now that you’re making some real money, maybe you can take your friend out for a nice thank-you dinner.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: And you probably have to invite your other friend ’cause she overheard you talking about it, and it would be awkward to exclude her.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: How about now?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: All right.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Don’t forget your wallet.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I, uh, huh.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Wow, there’s a Denny’s in Vegas you can actually get married in.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Doesn’t sound very romantic.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, but we could get heart-shaped pancakes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m sure we’ll find a decent chapel.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah. This is crazy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I know. You think people are gonna be mad?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Maybe. But this isn’t about them, it’s about us.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It is. It is about us.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: And you know what the best part is? We took our time. I mean, we met, we were friends for a couple years, then we got together, and then we got untogether, then we worked out all our problems, and now we know everything about each other, we can just go forward with no surprises and no regrets.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Right. No surprises.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: And no regrets.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh, well, there, there’s one thing I feel I should tell you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You know, so we can go into this with no secrets between us.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Remember, uh, a couple years back when I was on that research ship in the North Sea?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, well, there, there was a lot of drinking and craziness going on.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No, you told me.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, um, well, there was this girl.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What did you do?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Nothing really. It was just kissing.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: And then what?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And then nothing. I stopped it. But it still bothers me, and I wanted you to know.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: All right.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Did you ever do anything like this since we’ve been?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Nope, never.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, that’s too bad.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You know, can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hmm?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Why are you telling me this now?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, like I said, we’re about to get married, and I, I want a clean slate. No secrets.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really? Because to me, it seems like we’re about to get married and you’re trying to sabotage it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Would you rather I didn’t tell you?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No, I don’t want there to be secrets between us.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: See, now I’m confused. I mean, what, what am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, keep your mouth off other women.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I can do that. Uh, uh, from now on, this mouth, you and food, that’s it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Look, I’m not happy this happened, but I think I can get past it. I mean, we weren’t engaged at the time, and it was just kissing.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Right.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Just kissing.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It wasn’t even very good. She was a smoker, I’d just been seasick.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, that’s enough. Stop talking.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, we’re still getting married?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Because we love each other.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And it’s the happiest day of our lives.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ha-ha, don’t push it.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You look, you look really pretty tonight.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Thanks. I love that jacket.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Thank you. Thanks, thanks. I’m sorry. I can’t do this. My, my ex-girlfriend e-mailed me, and I’m seeing her Saturday, And I’m glad you like it, it’s from J. Crew.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: I don’t understand.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: My friends told me it was okay to see more than one person at a time, but it, it feels like I’m being deceitful.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Are you getting back together with her?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: No. I, I have no idea. What would you do?

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Uh, usually on first dates, I talk about music and stuff, but I was promised weird, so let’s do this. How serious were you two?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, to be honest, we only went on four dates, hugged twice, kissed once, and there was a handshake loaded with sexual innuendo.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Wait, so, a girl you never slept with sent you an e-mail and you felt so guilty about it that you had to tell me?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: That’s kind of adorable.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Are you, are you sure? Because this is the part of the night where I’ve said something stupid and the girl usually leaves.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: I’m still here.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yeah, but now you make me wonder what’s wrong with you.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: We just met. You don’t need to tell me about other people you’re seeing.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Really? Because I’m dating two women is basically the only cool thing I can say about myself.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, what if we go around the university and just get the patent ourselves?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: We can’t. It says on their Web site, as long as we work there, they have a controlling ownership of anything we come up with.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Great, so they own my idea for a T-shirt that says Dumb as a Bag of Geologists.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, our choices are we do this with the university or we don’t do it at all.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Either way, I get nothing.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Or, if we ended up making money from this, Sheldon and I could split our shares with you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: To be clear, Leonard is referring to the gyroscope, not the T-shirt and mugs. Oh, now they own the mugs.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I guess that is a way around this. You guys would be cool doing it like that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Of course, we can split any profits three ways.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m fine with that.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, great.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It sounds like a, uh, contract might be in order.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sure, we could write something up.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: But which one of us should be the party who…

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You can do it, Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: So stipulated.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Once I found a stash of contracts under his bed. It was weird.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Thanks for letting me come over.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Of course. Please, come in.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: I just wanted to say how sorry I am about tonight, and I want to make sure that we’re okay.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Uh, look, you and I haven’t made any commitments to each other.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: I know. I just felt like I needed to explain. The guy I was with did my last tattoo, and he’s been asking me out for months. I finally said yes just to get it over with.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: It’s okay.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, I mean, yeah, it freaked me out a little, but that’s my issue, not yours.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Wow. If I saw you out with another woman, I’d be pretty upset.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Thank you. Not just for being upset, but for believing that could happen.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Just so you know, I’m not seeing anyone else.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, me, neither.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Okay. Please. So, uh, you, you have tattoos?

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I don’t. I have a hole in my belly button that may or may not have been a piercing.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: That’s cool.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: It’s a piercing. So, uh, how many tattoos?

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: One on my shoulder, one not on my shoulder and one really not on my shoulder.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: It’s, uh, been a long time since I’ve seen a girl’s really not her shoulder.

turns.speaker: Emily
turns.transcript: Well, how about you show me your piercing and I show you my tattoos?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: But, uh, before I take my shirt off, I just need like ten minutes to do some crunches.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So, have you been having any morning sickness?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: A little. And it doesn’t help that I’ve got this heightened sense of smell.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Is that a pregnancy thing?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah. The other day I sniffed out where Howie hid the Girl Scout cookies. No more Tagalongs, my ass.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: But now you’ll be able to make your own milk to eat the cookies with.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey, guys. Hey, Penny. I really appreciate you helping me with this. I don’t know what to do.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, sure. Let me see it.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: See what?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I hadn’t spoken to Emily since I broke up with her, and she left this on my doorstep with a note.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Raj, I got you this before we split up, but couldn’t return it and thought you’d like to have it. Happy belated Valentine’s Day, Emily.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: That’s nice.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Nice, or is she trying to manipulate him?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I know. I mean, do I open it? Do I return it?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Why wouldn’t you open it?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, she was pretty mad. For all I know it’s a voodoo doll of me with a fork stuck in my junk.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You don’t think she’d actually send you something gross or dangerous, do you?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I know one way to find out. Sniff this.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: She’s pregnant, she’s not a bloodhound.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Although I am getting a little machine oil. I think it’s metal.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Come on, just open it.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You know, on Game of Thrones, Balon Greyjoy received his son’s genitals in a box.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, never hurts to have a spare.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What is that?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Wow. It’s an antique sextant. Sailors used these to find their position by the stars.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What a nice gift for an astrophysicist.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I know, she’s so thoughtful.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: See, she’s trying to get you back. Now, that is exactly what I would’ve gotten you if I had any idea what it is or what you do.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You know, I have too much self-esteem to let this girl guilt me into getting back together with her.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You don’t need to be pregnant to smell that load of crap.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Here you go.

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: Are these all from Peter Higgs?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hmm? Oh, no, no, no. They’re from many famous people. See? Oh, like this one. This is from Patrick Stewart. It says if I come to his house again, I get to meet his dogs. Oh, excuse me.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hello, Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, hello, Amy.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I was missing you again.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I miss you, too. Hey, this is good timing. Remember that Dr. Nowitzki I told you about? She’s right here.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: She’s what?

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: Hello.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Hi.

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: So nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Uh-huh. Hang on. (answering phone) Hello. A little late, Leonard. Sorry.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What is Leonard doing calling you at this hour?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: It’s not important.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I must tell you, that seems a little inappropriate. Don’t you agree?

turns.speaker: Ramona
turns.transcript: I do.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: See? We both think so.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s pretty late. You think I’ve got time to run some more simulations on the cooling system?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sure, I’m still figuring out the thermo-acoustic expander.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, while you do that I am going to pump cerebral spinal fluid through my brain cells to remove the metabolic by-products of the day’s thoughts.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s called sleep and it’s my bedtime. Nighty-night, y’all.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey, hey, hey, you’re not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We only have two months to deliver this to the Air Force because of you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I know, I was there.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, wake up, we’re gonna put in a lot of late nights.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: How late?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, I don’t know, midnight, one.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: One o’clock? I’m not a raccoon.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: If you’re tired, have some coffee.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What? You have some coffee.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I am having coffee.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And look how irritable it’s making you!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Guys, we’re not gonna get anything done if we start fighting. Now, can you please try

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Fine. (Time passing montage) I don’t think I can go much longer.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s been three and a half minutes, wake up.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: Uh, thanks for driving me home.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No problem. I’m really sorry about your car.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: Oh, it’s all right. If you’re free next weekend, I’d love to take you out again.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Um, listen, you’re a really nice guy, but I just, I don’t think this is working out.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: Oh. Okay.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I’m, I’m really sorry.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: No, it’s, at least the same woman that rejected Sheldon Cooper rejected me.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: There you go.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: If I ever do meet him, we’ll have that in common.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sure. Heh.

turns.speaker: Dave
turns.transcript: And, he’s kissed you and I’ve kissed you, so if you think about it…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay, get out.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey, got a minute?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, of course, come in. (Raj opens door to reveal Howard) This is an authentic Chinese throwing star, and I must warn you, I have seen many people throw them in movies.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Calm down. Howard has something he wants to say to you.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: All right. Sheldon, when this whole thing with the parking space started, I had no idea just how much of a crazy bastard…

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Howard, that’s not how we practiced it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I had no idea how much that spot meant to you. Anyway, I called President Siebert and told him it’s not worth fighting over the spot, so you keep it, and I’ll park in the structure across the street.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, Howard, thank you. It’s quite a gesture on your part. You’ve shown yourself to be the bigger man.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Which I find totally unacceptable. I must be the bigger man. Therefore, you may use my spot until such time as I learn to drive or get a Batmobile.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Wow, okay. Well, thanks. I don’t know what to say.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: There is nothing to say. Except I’m the bigger man. I’m not kidding. Say it.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Just say it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You’re the bigger man, Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, stop. And I believe this is yours. FYI, if you wear that into a bank, they will tackle you to the ground.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: One vintage Mr. Mxyzptlk action figure. That’s Leonard’s.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Children’s toy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: One Star Trek: The Next Generation phaser. That’s Leonard’s.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Children’s toy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: One Game of Thrones collector’s edition Longclaw sword. Oh, Leonard and I bought that together. That’s a bit of an ethical conundrum. Eh, I’ll keep it.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So, uh, what’s your plan moving forward?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Uh, suppose I’ll have to find and cultivate a new roommate. What a task that will be. Do you know how uncivilized Leonard was when I took him in?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, it took me forever to get him on a bathroom schedule. He would just go whenever the mood struck him.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Like a dog-boy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Exactly.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What if you could find a roommate who was a scientist and already familiar and comfortable with your ways?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That would be ideal. If a person like that existed, I would sign on, no further questions asked.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Great. Here I am!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wait. Here who is where?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Me. Aren’t I your perfect roommate?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Um…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Think about it, Sheldon. I’m not a stranger, we’re intellectually compatible, I’m willing to chauffeur you around town, and your personality quirks, which others find abhorrent or rage-inducing, I find cute as a button. What do you think?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Um…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Tell me one reason why this isn’t a fantastic idea.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Um…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: See? You can’t. I’m gonna go see if Leonard’s room is big enough for my water bed.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Um…

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I was told this is where to go if I’m mad at Howard.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: May I take your cloak?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Thanks. This thing kept getting caught in the chain of my bike.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I’ll catch you up. Uh, Penny is angry at Leonard, Leonard’s angry at me and Penny, I’m angry at Leonard and Amy, Raj is angry at Howard, and I’m angry at George R.R. Martin ’cause there are no new books for me to spoil for Leonard.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: So what happened with you and Howard?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Says I was talking too much about dating Claire and Emily, and I accused him of being jealous.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I’m jealous. Closest I’ve come to dating two women was that time I dated one woman.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Helium.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Taylor Swift.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes. Pi.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. Kardashian.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: More specific.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Khloe?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: See, I remembered because if it looks like Kim it’s Kim, if it looks kind of like Kim it’s Kourtney, and if it looks nothing like Kim it’s Khloe.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, that’s a Venn Diagram, and I remember because I thought to myself, venn is he gonna stop talking about this diagram?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What are you guys doing?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, well, we decided to use our breakfast time to expand our respective knowledge bases.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, let me try.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hmm, atom of hydrogen, Adam of Maroon 5, mic drop.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m sorry, who is Mike Drop?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, hey, Penny, do you want to go to the airport with me later to pick up my mother?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thanks.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No problem.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, Penny, um, since you’re already gonna be at the airport, do I need to go?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Why don’t you want to get your mother from the airport?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, I can do without the 40-minute car ride where she criticizes every aspect of my life.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: She can cover it in a car ride? I could do 40 minutes on your posture alone.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You really want me to pick up your mother all by myself?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hmm, I just feel like it would be a good chance for you to bond.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Or a way for you to avoid her?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t know what he’s putting on those cards, but you are smarter than ever.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Fine, if you really want me to, I will pick your mom up.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Seriously?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, you know what, she is my mother-in-law, and I’d like for us to have a good relationship.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That is very mature of you, so I’m gonna go ahead and say, suckah.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, back to learning.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, easy, Bill Nye the Science Guy.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Or as I know him?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Creepy old dude from Dancing with the Stars.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ding, ding, ding, ding, ding.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Come on, Bernie, breathe. Remember what you learned in birthing class.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I remember thinking this is stupid, and I was right.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Do you want me to get the nurse?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: No. If one more person puts their fingers near my uterus, I’m gonna cross my legs and snap ’em off.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Uh, Sheldon? Sheldon?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Arthur. What are you doing here? I, I don’t think I need any more advice.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: I, I was just curious. How, how’d it go?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh. It was amazing. I, I saw it a few days later. What a movie.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: But, uh, what, what about Amy?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh. Uh, uh, she liked it fine. But she doesn’t have the history with the franchise I do.

turns.speaker: Arthur
turns.transcript: Okay. Good, good talk.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You know, in the future, when we’re disembodied brains in jars, we’re going to look back on this as eight hours well wasted.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I don’t want to be in a jar. I want my brain in an android body. Eight feet tall and ripped.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m with you. I just have to make sure if I’m a synthetic human I’d still be Jewish. I promised my mother.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I suppose you could have your android penis circumcised. But that’s something your Rabbi would have to discuss with the manufacturers.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not to mention you’d have to power down on Saturdays.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, why is this letter in the trash?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, there’s always the possibility that a trash can spontaneously formed around the letter, but Occam’s Razor would suggest that someone threw it out.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s from the Institute for Experimental Physics. They want us to present our paper on the properties of super solids at the topical conference on Bowes-Einstein condensates.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I know. I read it before I threw it out.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay… if I may drill down to the bedrock of my question, why did you throw it out.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because I have no interest in standing in the Rose Room of the Pasadena Marriott in front of a group of judgemental strangers, who wouldn’t recognise true genius if it were standing in front of them giving a speech. Which, if I were there, it would be.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t know, Sheldon, those topical conferences on Bowes-Einstein condensates parties are legendary.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Forget the parties.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Forget the parties? What a nerd.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are there any other honours I’ve gotten that I don’t know about? Did UPS drop off a Nobel Prize with my name on it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Leonard, please don’t take this the wrong way, but the day you win a Nobel Prize, is the day I begin my research on the drag co-efficient of tassles on flying carpets.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hoo-hoo-hoo. The only thing missing from that insult was “yo mamma.”

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’ve got one, hey Leonard, your mamma’s research methodology is so flawed….

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Shut up, Howard. Sheldon, we have to do this.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No we don’t. We have to take in nourishment, expel waste, and inhale enough oxygen to keep ourselves from dying, everything else is optional.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, let me put it this way, I’m doing it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You can’t. I’m the lead author.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, come on. The only reason you’re the lead author is because we went alphabetically.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I let you think we went alphabetically to spare you the humiliation of dealing with the fact that it was my idea. Not to put too fine a point on it, but I was throwing you a bone. You’re welcome.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Excuse me, I designed the experiment that proved the hypothesis.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It doesn’t need proving.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So the entire scientific community is just supposed to take your word?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: They’re not supposed to, but they should.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Alright, I don’t care what you say, I’m going to the conference and I’m presenting our findings.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And I forbid it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You forbid it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: If I’m not taking credit for our work then nobody is.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, you admit that it’s our work.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, once again, I’m throwing you a bone. And once again, you are welcome.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Ah!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh no he dit’nt!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Damn it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We’re out of ice.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, men, we begin initial assembly and deployment of the testing equipment starting tomorrow at 0700 hours, but until then, you are all off duty. I suggest you keep the shenanigans to a minimum as medical help is 18 hours away by dogsled.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What are you working on?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Crossbow.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, guys, can I just say something? How about we take a moment to think about where we are right now? This is literally the top of the world. Only a handful of people in all of human history will ever see what we are going to see.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: He’s right.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah, wow.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It is remarkable.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: So, who’s up for a movie?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Good idea, what do you think? Ice Station Zebra or John Carpenter’s The Thing?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I say double feature.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Dinner’s ready!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What are we having?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Reconstituted Thai food.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Did you bring the dehydrated low-sodium soy sauce?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Check.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Freeze-dried spicy mustard?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Check.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Flash-frozen brown rice, not white?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh, oh, sorry.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not to worry. I hid it. Bazinga! You’re in my spot.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: There’s no time for a crossbow. Find me an icicle.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Three months. This is gonna be great!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Should we get lunch or you want to eat at the zoo? Oh, Howie, I don’t need food as long as I can look at my phone.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I don’t like when you imitate me.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You want to hear my Stuart? It’s been a while since I’ve gone on a date. You mind if we watch the monkeys doing it?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I said that to you in confidence.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: This is supposed to be our family fun day. What’s so important on your phone?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’m on the day care’s website.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Stop looking at that. The day care’s great. It’s on campus. My office is two minutes away. There’s nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What if she likes the people who work there more than us?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: She already likes soap bubbles more than us.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: When I go back to work, we’re gonna leave her with these people. We don’t know anything about them.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: They’re highly-trained educators with background checks. They’re even required to be current on all vaccinations.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: You leave her with me, and I’m not any of those things.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: After you wrap the body in reflective tape, the ends get Teflon tape so we can get a tight seal.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Like this?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, perfect.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And it helps to have small, delicate fingers. So don’t be discouraged if you can’t do it as fast as me and Howard.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t know if we have enough solder to finish these circuit boards.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We had a full spool yesterday.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What can I say, I play hard, I solder even harder.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Sometimes he solders at home with his shirt off. It’s like a beer commercial.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, we got to make a run to the hardware store.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: How can you call yourself a scientist and run out of solder?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, funny story. So, we have plenty of the 60/40 tin-to-lead ratio solder, but the spools look a lot like the 63/37 tin-to-lead…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Honey, honey, honey, let me stop you. That is, is not a funny story.

turns.transcript: Yeah, you’re right. That is the term I’m looking for. You are a dirty double mother suckler.

turns.transcript: Uch.

turns.transcript: Oh, okay, well maybe you should start heading on out then.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, this is fun. Oh, the thing about tomatoes, and I think you’ll really enjoy this, is, they’re shelved with the vegetables, but they’re technically a fruit.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Interesting.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Isn’t it?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No, I mean what you find enjoyable.

turns.speaker: supplements)
turns.transcript: Oh boy.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What now?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, there’s some value to taking a multivitamin, but the human body can only absorb so much, what you’re buying here are the ingredients for very expensive urine.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, maybe that’s what I was going for.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well then you’ll want some manganese.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What’s so funny?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Nothing. Just thinking about the noises people make during sex.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I do sometimes get a bit carried away, don’t I?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s cute. You sound a little like a drunken monkey. Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You know it’s meant as a compliment.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: That’s how I take it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: This is perfect. I hope this moment never ends.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Me too.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, gotta go.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Oh! Already? Why don’t you stay over?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, I’d love to, but you know my mother needs me in the morning.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Please, I think the woman can manage to put a wig on by herself.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s not just the wig. It’s pinning her hair up, drawing on her eyebrows. It’s a two-person job.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s just, when you leave right after we make love, it makes me feel cheap.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, honey, I’m sorry. What can I do?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Stay.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay. Like, what, another five, ten minutes?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Go home.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Your call.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howard, have you ever considered us living together?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Boy, I don’t know. You, me, Ma living under the same roof?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: No, I mean just you and me. You can move in here, or we can find a place.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’ve got a better solution.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: We wait for my mom’s heart to explode from all the salt she eats. Then we just stick her in the ground, flip her mattress and move into the big bedroom.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Great.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Look at us planning a future together.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: See? Isn’t this better than a hotel room?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yep. Shake that thing.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Have you ever seen a body so fine?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: We had some pretty hot corpses in my anatomy class, but none of them moved like that.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: This contract looks good to me.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’ll say it looks good. It’s in my proprietary font, Shelvetica.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I want to say something obnoxious, but it is easy on the eyes.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’m a little tired, Howie. You ready to go?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah, one sec. I just need to sign this contract.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What is it?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, we ran into a problem about my share of the patent, so we’re forming a partnership to split anything we make equally.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sheldon, did you draft the contract?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You bet I did.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ooh. You’re gonna make out so hard tonight.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: So, you’re just gonna sign this without having a lawyer look at it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Excuse me. I’ve been drafting contracts since kindergarten. Didn’t need a lawyer to get me out of finger painting. Don’t need one now.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I know, but…

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Bernie, the guys were nice enough to find a way to keep me from being cut out.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, I should hope so. The whole thing was your idea.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, to be fair, Howard’s idea was based on Sheldon’s math.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Guys, everyone is involved in thios, okay? Howard’s invention, Sheldon’s math, my original theory that space-time was like a supercooled liquid. Which I’m sure Penny would’ve mentioned if she wasn’t working on that hangnail right now.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Honey, this is fine.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: If you want to sign a contract that Sheldon whipped up, go ahead.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Can I talk to you in the hall?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Excuse us.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hey, Leonard.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: If she doesn’t think that we should apply for this patent, she’s being patently absurd.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Good one.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, you got it. See, I was afraid it was a thinker.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I just want to make sure you’ve thought this through.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What’s to think about? We have an invention and want to move forward.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howie, you’re about to form a legal partnership with Sheldon Cooper.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: All right, if you’re gonna calmly make excellent points, then I don’t know if I want to talk to you. Okay. I get it. And it’s sweet that you’re worried about me, but I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’m not worried about you. I’m worried about me. I don’t want to go through this pregnancy listening to you complain about Sheldon driving you crazy more than you already do.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Here we go with the ironclad logic again.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You’ve tried to work with him before. It hasn’t gone well. Why is this time gonna be any different?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Is the foetus helping you? ‘Cause that’s cheating.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Which side of the bed would you prefer?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Doesn’t matter to me. Your choice.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, no, we’re living together now, everything’s equal. You know? I know that I have a tendency to be controlling, so I would rather you choose.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, Sheldon, I really appreciate that, but these things mean more to you than they do to me, so whatever you want.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, clearly, it’s not whatever I want, because what I want is for you to make this decision, and you refuse to do that.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, I’m not refusing. I’m just trying to be considerate.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Like when you let me get those shoes with the wheels on the bottom, and then watched me roll right into traffic?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon, will you please just pick a side?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Fine. Okay. Now, on this side, I am closer to the exit in case of emergency.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Great. That’s your side.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, but I’m also closer to the entrance in case of attack.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay, I’ll take that side.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Ah, then again, what are the odds of someone attacking me?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Rising rapidly.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Now, this side offers me proximity to the bathroom, but I am closer to the window where perverts can watch me sleep.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Okay. What if we do this?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I suppose that works.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Great.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Although now I’m kind of worried someone’s hiding behind those drapes.
